title: Managing Asset Metadata
description: A comprehensive guide to creating, editing, and optimizing metadata for your digital assets and folders in Brandworkz
prerequisites: Permission to create and edit asset metadata
Permission to create and edit folder metadata
Basic understanding of your organization's metadata schema

sections.name: Understanding Metadata Fields
steps: Log in to the Brandworkz platform using your credentials
Navigate to Admin > Metadata Management
Review the list of available metadata fields
Note the required fields that must be completed for each asset type
sections.notes: Different asset types may have different metadata requirements. Make sure you're familiar with the specific fields for your content.

sections.name: Adding Metadata to New Assets
steps: Start the upload process for your asset
Complete all the required metadata fields marked with an asterisk (*)
Add values to optional fields that will help with searchability
Include keywords that describe the asset's content, purpose, and usage rights
Add any relevant taxonomies or categories
Complete the upload process
sections.tips: Be thorough with keywords - think about how users might search for this asset.

sections.name: Editing Metadata for Existing Assets
steps: Search for and locate the asset you want to update
Select the asset to view its details
Click the 'Edit' or 'Edit Metadata' button
Make your changes to the metadata fields
Save your changes
troubleshooting: If you can't edit metadata, check your user permissions
If certain fields are greyed out, they may be system-controlled fields that cannot be edited
For required fields that have validation errors, ensure your input matches the expected format

sections.name: Bulk Metadata Editing
steps: Search for or browse to find multiple assets that need the same metadata updates
Select all relevant assets by checking the boxes next to them
Click the 'Bulk Edit' or 'Edit Metadata' option from the actions menu
Select which metadata fields you want to update across all selected assets
Enter the new values for these fields
Confirm and save your changes
sections.notes: Bulk editing is powerful but use with caution as it will overwrite existing values for all selected assets.

sections.name: Creating Metadata Templates
steps: Navigate to Admin > Metadata Templates
Click 'Create New Template'
Give your template a descriptive name
Select which asset types this template applies to
Pre-fill the metadata fields that should be applied automatically
Save your template
sections.tips: Templates are great for assets that share common metadata like campaign names, usage rights, or expiration dates.
